item.title: Barbara add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is likely I will die next to a pile of things I was meaning to read." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Fitzgerald
item.description: "They were stars on this stage, each playing to an audience of two: the passion of their pretense created the actuality. Here, finally, was the quintessence of self-expression-- yet it was probable that for the most part their love expressed Gloria rather than Anthony. He felt often like a scarecly tolerated guest at a party she was giving." -- Fitzgerald

item.title: Barbara add a quote by T. S. Eliot
item.description: "We shall not cease from exploration And the end of all our exploring Will be to arrive where we started And know the place for the first time." -- T. S. Eliot

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "One can't love humanity. One can only love people." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "When you visualized a man or a woman carefully, you could always begin to feel pity . . . that was a quality God's image carried with it . . . when you saw the lines at the corners of the eyes, the shape of the mouth, how the hair grew, it was impossible to hate. Hate was just a failure of imagination." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Jhumpa Lahiri
item.description: "That's the thing about books. They let you travel without moving your feet." -- Jhumpa Lahiri

item.title: Barbara add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes
